description: The Textarea component is a flexible and customizable UI element for user input. It supports various styles, sizes, and can display helper text and error messages.

props.name: helperText
props.description: Helper text displayed below the textarea.

props.name: placeholder
props.description: Placeholder text when no value is entered.

props.name: error
props.description: If true, the textarea will display an error state.

props.name: required
props.description: If true, the textarea will display a required indicator.

props.name: disabled
props.description: If true, the textarea is disabled.

props.name: fullWidth
props.description: If true, the textarea will take up the full width of its container.

examples.title: Sizes
examples.description: Different sizes of textareas including medium and small.
examples.code:
<Textarea label="Small Textarea" size="small" placeholder="Enter text" />
<Textarea label="Medium Textarea" size="medium" placeholder="Enter text" />

examples.title: Disabled
examples.description: Textareas that are disabled and not interactive.

examples.title: Error State
examples.description: Textareas that display an error state.
examples.code: <Textarea label="Textarea with Error" error helperText="Error text" />

examples.title: Full Width
examples.description: Textareas that take up the full width of their container.
examples.code: <Textarea label="Full Width Textarea" fullWidth placeholder="Enter text" />

examples.title: Label and Helper Text
examples.description: Textareas with a label and helper text displayed.
examples.code:
<Textarea label="Textarea with Label" placeholder="Enter text" />
<Textarea label="Textarea with Helper Text" helperText="Helper text" />

examples.title: Required
examples.description: Textareas that display a required indicator.

css.description: Styles applied to the field root.
